benchmark_details.name: SM3-Text-to-Query (Synthetic Multi-Model Medical Text-to-Query Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: SM3-Text-to-Query is the first multi-model medical Text-to-Query benchmark that provides data representations for relational databases, document stores, and graph databases, allowing evaluations across four query languages: SQL, MQL, Cypher, and SPARQL.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate Text-to-Query systems across multiple core database models and query languages in a medical context.

data.source: Synthetic patient data generated from Synthea.
data.annotation: Systematically and manually developed template questions augmented with values to construct diverse question/query pairs.

methodology.calculation: EA is calculated as the fraction of questions where the outcomes of predicted and ground-truth queries yield identical results.
methodology.interpretation: Higher EA indicates better translation of natural language questions to query statements across different database models.
methodology.validation: Dataset was developed with input from medical professionals to ensure relevance and accuracy.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data was generated synthetically, thus there are no privacy risks.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Dataset and code to be released under CC-BY-SA license.
